solution_line_template: 18 mph slower than {flat_speed} mph is {flat_speed}-{uphill_decrease}=<<{flat_speed}-{uphill_decrease}={uphill_speed}>>{uphill_speed} mph.

If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages ({flat_speed}+{downhill_speed}+{uphill_speed})/{time_fraction} = <<({flat_speed}+{downhill_speed}+{uphill_speed})/{time_fraction}={average_speed}>>{average_speed} mph.
